subject: Personal Finance
title: APR vs APY
description: A micro-lesson that makes APR vs APY usable.

hook.text: Your credit card says 20% APR. Your savings account says 5% APY. They measure different things.

buildup.text: APR is the annual percentage rate â€” the base rate without compounding factored in.

discovery.text: APY includes compounding effects, making it higher than APR for the same nominal rate.

twist.text: Lenders advertise APR on loans to make rates look lower. Banks advertise APY on savings to look higher.

climax.text: Both are legal and accurate. But comparing APR on debt to APY on savings is like apples to oranges.

punchline.text: Read the fine print: APR or APY?

quiz.question: Why do lenders advertise APR instead of APY on loans?
options: APR looks lower because it excludes compounding
